txstates.txstate: Severe abrasions and loss of colour.

details.detail:
Wooden triptych, gesso on wood in own frame, wings significantly thinner and smaller than centre panel, heavy damage to gesso priming on wings.
Left wing upper half: Orans Gebre Menfes Queddus on yellow to green background. Left wing lower half: The baptism of Christ. Interesting depiction with St. John the Baptist holding a cross-topped staff while sitting on the water. Jesus is immersed up to the waist in the water, John's hand is resting on Jesus' head (which is surrounded by a multicoloured halo). In the upper right corner, God the Father looks on from the clouds, with a dove poised in flight below him.
Centre panel: Typically Gondar II type Virgin with the Child. Seated on a cushion in front of a canopy, Mary has the Child on her left arm. Her garments are blue with a green lining and richly ornamented. A handkerchief is in her left hand. Jesus is dressed in red, holding a book and extending his right arm in blessing. Both have multicoloured ray halos. Two armed angels are standing in the background.
Right wing upper half (badly damaged): The Last Supper? Many figures seated (among them possibly a crowned Mary?!) at a long table, with one figure standing on the left side with one arm raised. Right wing lower half (badly damaged): The Beheading of John the Baptist. A figure with a blue turban holds a long sword in their right hand and a severed head by its hair in their left arm and hands it to a second figure on the right, who is carrying a basket. A headless body (John) with a naked torso is in the process of falling to the ground, the blood still spouting from the neck.
Interesting iconography, very unusal. Style is very firmly Gondar II and well executed.
